summary: This is a July 2, 2020 press release from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York announcing the arrest and indictment of Ghislaine Maxwell. It charges her with conspiracy with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors, including enticing and transporting minors, and with perjury related to 2016 depositions. The document details the alleged grooming and abuse scheme spanning from 1994 to 1997.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Arrested and charged with conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors, facilitating the grooming and abuse of victims as young as 14, and committing perjury in 2016 depositions.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as Maxwell's co-conspirator who, with Maxwell, exploited and sexually abused minor girls from at least 1994 to 1997.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.role: Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Issued the press release and made a statement condemning Maxwell's alleged role in facilitating and participating in the sexual abuse of minors.

persons.name: William F. Sweeney Jr.
persons.role: Assistant Director-in-Charge of the FBI New York Field Office
persons.context: Made a statement praising the bravery of the victims and condemning Maxwell and Epstein's disregard for the law.

persons.name: Dermot Shea
persons.role: Commissioner of the New York City Police Department (NYPD)
persons.context: Made a statement commending investigators and partners for their commitment to bringing justice to survivors of sexual assault.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge to whom Maxwell's case is assigned.

connections.description: Alleged to have conspired together to recruit, groom, and sexually abuse minor girls from at least 1994 to 1997.
Maxwell is alleged to have facilitated Epstein's abuse of minors and, in some cases, participated in the abuse herself.

events.title: Arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested and charged in a Manhattan federal court with conspiracy to sexually abuse minors with Jeffrey Epstein and perjury.

events.title: Period of Alleged Abuse Conspiracy
events.description: The indictment alleges Maxwell and Epstein conspired to sexually abuse minor girls, with victims as young as 14, during this period.

events.title: Maxwell's False Deposition Testimony
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell made several false statements under oath during depositions in a civil proceeding, leading to perjury charges.

locations: New Hampshire (where Maxwell was to be presented in court)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested on July 2, 2020, and charged with conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors.
The indictment alleges the abuse scheme operated from at least 1994 to 1997, involving victims as young as 14 years old.
Maxwell is accused of playing a critical role in grooming victims by befriending them, taking them on trips, and normalizing sexual interactions with Epstein.
Abuse allegedly occurred at Epstein's residences in New York, Florida, and New Mexico, as well as at Maxwell's residence in London.
Maxwell was also charged with two counts of perjury for false statements made under oath in 2016 depositions.
